page.title: 12Irthlingborough's New Bridge
page.content: The new bridge was built because the old bridge could not carry the weight of modern day traffic. It was built in 1936. At that time there was a railway line beside the river with a gated level crossing on the road,so, the new bridge was designed to overcome both of these problems at the same time. By comparison to the old bridge, the new one is very long,nearly a quarter of a mile. It is actually 420 metres long and 10 metres high. It is a viaduct design with 50 arches and it is made of re-inforced concrete. It can be described as "functional" rather than "beautiful". At the same time, a much needed by-pass for Irthlingborough was also built. It was all opened on October 23rd 1936 by Mr.Leslie Hore-Belisha,who at that time was the Minister of Transport.
